dubai.description: On nights when the Burj Khalifa fountains shoot up like music, the glass walls of Sheikh Zayed Road reflected each other's stars, and the monorail skimming the coast redrew the boundaries of sand outside the windows, while the lights turning on along the curves of the Palm stretched like leaf veins along the sea, and with each new line announced on the map, the skyline's musical notes rose one step higher.

gdpGrowth.title: GDP Growth Rate
gdpGrowth.description: Maintains a stable annual economic growth rate of 4.2%, serving as the economic center of the Middle East region.

foreignInvestment.title: Foreign Investment
foreignInvestment.description: Foreign direct investment (FDI) of $185 billion in 2023, making it the largest investment attraction city in the Middle East.

tourism.title: Tourism Industry
tourism.description: Attracts 16.8 million tourists annually, with tourism revenue accounting for 12% of GDP as a major industry.

hochiminh.description: When the Ben Thanh clock strikes noon, the waves of Nguyen Hue shattered sunlight into fragments, and following the wind crossing the Saigon River, the empty lots of Thu Thiem drew their lines first from bridges and promenades, while window heights added one layer at a time like flyers stacked in mailboxes, until suddenly the outlines of landmarks attached themselves to the neighborhood's daily life.

gdpGrowth.title: GDP Growth Rate
gdpGrowth.description: Achieved 8.2% GDP growth in 2023, the highest economic growth level in Southeast Asia.

population.title: Population Structure
population.description: Composed of young population with average age of 31, with economically active population ratio of 68%.

startup.title: Startup Ecosystem
startup.description: Over 2,800 startups active as of 2023, with venture capital investment reaching $1.5 billion.

johorbahru.description: Every morning when the Causeway's line stretches long over the sea, the steps of Sultan Abu Bakar sparkled in the sunlight, and as the sun set, lights turned on one by one along the Tanjung Balai promenade, while the dream of 'sea view rooms' gently swayed in each window, and as the lights of the city across the way grew closer, this place's skyline gradually grew its body from thin lines to thick lines.

economicGrowth.title: Economic Growth Rate
economicGrowth.description: 6.8% economic growth rate in 2023, recording the highest growth rate in Malaysia.

manufacturing.title: Manufacturing Center
manufacturing.description: Manufacturing accounts for 45% of GDP, with electronics exports accounting for 38% of total exports.

education.title: Education Infrastructure
education.description: 45 international schools and 12 universities operate, serving as an education hub adjacent to Singapore.

phnompenh.description: In the afternoon when the palace's golden light trembled thinly in the river wind, like the heat cooling under the Central Market dome, the shadows of old roofs were gradually pushed away, and as the Tonle Sap's waterway changed its body with each season, the signs and lights along the river also added layers, slowly carving the city's outline at different heights each night.

gdpGrowth.title: GDP Growth Rate
gdpGrowth.description: 7.1% GDP growth rate in 2023, showing the fastest economic growth in Southeast Asia.

population.title: Population Structure
population.description: Composed of very young population with average age of 25, with economically active population ratio of 72%.

culture.title: Cultural Heritage
culture.description: Possesses 3 UNESCO World Heritage sites, serving as a cultural center attracting 2.8 million cultural tourists annually.

shanghai.description: In the evening when the Bund and Lujiazui reflected each other across the river, while the maglev train outran the wind and the brick smell of old alleys under plane tree shade turned into coffee fragrance, the names of towers piled up in memory one floor at a time to the rhythm of steel behind fences, and the city measured time by construction numbers instead of seasons, dividing the river's night with new graduations.

gdpSize.title: GDP Size
gdpSize.description: GDP of $472 billion in 2023, China's largest economic city and the world's 3rd largest economic city.

financialCenter.title: Financial Center
financialCenter.description: Shanghai Stock Exchange market cap of $7.2 trillion, possessing Asia's largest financial market.

globalCompanies.title: Global Companies
globalCompanies.description: 480 Fortune 500 companies have entered, operating the world's largest free trade port as a global business hub.

seoul.description: On nights when the N Seoul Tower lights breathed in sync with the weather, I saw that each time the Han River wind changed direction, the cranes beyond the barriers lowered one day at a time, and the names of new complexes flowing along bus windows became reality and rose above the skyline.

gdpSize.title: GDP Size
gdpSize.description: GDP of $385 billion in 2023, accounting for 50% of Korea's economy and Asia's 4th largest economic city.

techInnovation.title: Technology Innovation
techInnovation.description: R&D investment ratio of 4.2%, the highest level in OECD, with 150,000 patent applications annually.

digitalInfra.title: Digital Infrastructure
digitalInfra.description: 95% 5G network penetration, world's fastest internet speed, leading digital innovation.
